newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk Garanti bank to sell bank unit.
newsitem.headline: Turk Garanti bank to sell bank unit.

text.p: T. Garanti Bankasi A.S., one of Turkey's big private banks, said on Thursday it reached a preliminary agreement to sell its 85 percent stake in banking subsidiary Bankekspres for $85 million.

"A preliminary deal has been made and Bankekspres's value has been set at $100 million, thus setting an $85 million sale value for our 85 percent equity stake in the bank," Garanti said in a statement sent to the Istanbul Stock Exchange.
The sale is subject to approval by the Treasury.

Garanti said the price would be received in cash. The profit from the sale would be determined after the completion of the process. Garanti's executive board is to later decide on how to use this profit.
Leading Turkish newspapers reported on Thursday that contractor Korkmaz Yigit would buy Bankekspres.
